when_to_say: Use as a greeting when you meet someone
example: Hola, ¿cómo estás? (Hello, how are you?)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a person you have a friendly relationship with
example: Él es mi amigo. (He is my friend.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a building where people live
example: Mi casa está cerca de la playa. (My house is near the beach.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about eating food
example: Voy a comer una manzana. (I am going to eat an apple.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to the liquid essential for life
example: ¿Puedo tener un poco de agua? (Can I have some water?)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a physical or digital text
example: Estoy leyendo un libro. (I am reading a book.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a job or occupation
example: Mi trabajo es interesante. (My work is interesting.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to something that can be eaten
example: La comida está lista. (The food is ready.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a place for education
example: Los niños van a la escuela. (The children go to school.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to the group of people related by blood or marriage
example: Mi familia es muy unida. (My family is very close.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about moving quickly on foot
example: Me gusta correr por la mañana. (I like to run in the morning.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to an adult female person
example: Ella es una mujer muy inteligente. (She is a very intelligent woman.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to an adult male person
example: Ese hombre es mi padre. (That man is my father.)

when_to_say: Use to describe something of a large size
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: Use to describe something of a small size
example: Tengo un perro pequeño. (I have a small dog.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a collection of written or printed words
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (I am reading an interesting book.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a piece of furniture with a flat top
example: La comida está sobre la mesa. (The food is on the table.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a piece of furniture used for sitting
example: Esta silla es cómoda. (This chair is comfortable.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to footwear
example: Me gustan estos zapatos. (I like these shoes.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to sweet edible fruits
example: Me gusta comer fruta fresca. (I like to eat fresh fruit.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to any type of food
example: La comida está deliciosa. (The food is delicious.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a liquid you drink
example: Quiero una bebida fría. (I want a cold drink.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a job or task
example: Mi trabajo es muy importante. (My work is very important.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a feline animal
example: Mi gato es muy juguetón. (My cat is very playful.)

when_to_say: Use to refer to a canine animal
example: Tengo un perro grande. (I have a big dog.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about the expanse above the Earth
example: El cielo está despejado. (The sky is clear.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to our planet or ground
example: La tierra es nuestro hogar. (The Earth is our home.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about the star that gives light to the Earth
example: El sol brilla en el cielo. (The sun shines in the sky.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about Earth's natural satellite
example: La luna está llena esta noche. (The moon is full tonight.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about celestial bodies in the sky
example: Las estrellas brillan en la noche. (The stars shine at night.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a large natural elevation of the Earth's surface
example: La montaña es muy alta. (The mountain is very tall.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a large, flowing body of water
example: El río es profundo. (The river is deep.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a large body of saltwater
example: Me gusta nadar en el mar. (I like to swim in the sea.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a large inland body of water
example: El lago está congelado. (The lake is frozen.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a dense area with many trees
example: El bosque es muy tranquilo. (The forest is very peaceful.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a large plant with a trunk
example: El árbol tiene muchas hojas. (The tree has many leaves.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the reproductive part of a plant
example: La flor es muy colorida. (The flower is very colorful.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about the green parts of a plant
example: La hoja cae del árbol. (The leaf falls from the tree.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the underground part of a plant
example: La raíz crece bajo la tierra. (The root grows underground.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the small, hard part of a plant that can grow into a new plant
example: La semilla crece en la tierra. (The seed grows in the soil.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about footwear
example: Me compré unos zapatos nuevos. (I bought new shoes.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a casual shirt
example: Ella lleva una camiseta roja. (She is wearing a red T-shirt.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to trousers or pants
example: Tengo pantalones nuevos. (I have new pants.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a head covering
example: Él lleva un sombrero de paja. (He is wearing a straw hat.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a piece of cloth worn around the neck
example: Mi bufanda es muy cálida. (My scarf is very warm.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a light outer garment
example: Voy a ponerme la chaqueta. (I am going to put on the jacket.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a women's garment
example: Ella lleva un vestido azul. (She is wearing a blue dress.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a skirt
example: Me encanta mi falda nueva. (I love my new skirt.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to hand coverings
example: Hace frío, necesito mis guantes. (It is cold, I need my gloves.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a small compartment in clothing
example: Puse las llaves en mi bolsillo. (I put the keys in my pocket.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a small case for holding money and cards
example: Perdí mi cartera. (I lost my wallet.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a bag worn on the back
example: Llevo mi mochila a la escuela. (I carry my backpack to school.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a strap worn around the waist
example: Mi cinturón es de cuero. (My belt is made of leather.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a store that sells shoes
example: Voy a la zapatería a comprar zapatos. (I’m going to the shoe store to buy shoes.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a timepiece
example: Tengo un reloj nuevo. (I have a new watch.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a small circular ornament worn on the finger
example: Mi anillo es de oro. (My ring is made of gold.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to jewelry worn around the neck
example: Ella tiene un collar de perlas. (She has a pearl necklace.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a piece of jewelry worn around the wrist
example: Me regalaron una pulsera. (They gave me a bracelet as a gift.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a piece of headwear
example: Él lleva un sombrero elegante. (He is wearing an elegant hat.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to eyewear
example: Necesito gafas para leer. (I need glasses to read.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a lighting device
example: La lámpara está encendida. (The lamp is on.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an opening in a wall or building
example: Abre la ventana, por favor. (Open the window, please.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an entrance or exit
example: Cierra la puerta. (Close the door.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a piece of furniture for sitting
example: Me siento en la silla. (I sit in the chair.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a flat surface for eating or working
example: La mesa está limpia. (The table is clean.)

when_to_say: Use when talking about a piece of furniture for sleeping
example: Me voy a dormir en la cama. (I am going to sleep in the bed.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a reflective surface
example: Me miro en el espejo. (I look at myself in the mirror.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a utensil for eating or cooking
example: Voy a usar una cuchara. (I’m going to use a spoon.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a utensil for eating
example: Necesito un tenedor. (I need a fork.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a utensil for cutting
example: El cuchillo está muy afilado. (The knife is very sharp.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a container for drinking
example: Dame un vaso de agua. (Give me a glass of water.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a flat dish for food
example: El plato está lleno. (The plate is full.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a small container for drinking, typically for hot beverages
example: La taza está en la mesa. (The cup is on the table.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a pan for cooking
example: Voy a freír los huevos en la sartén. (I’m going to fry the eggs in the frying pan.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a deep cooking vessel
example: La olla está sobre la estufa. (The pot is on the stove.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a cooking appliance
example: Pon la olla en la estufa. (Put the pot on the stove.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an appliance used for cooling food
example: Guarda la leche en el refrigerador. (Put the milk in the refrigerator.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a microwave oven
example: Voy a calentar la sopa en el microondas. (I’m going to heat up the soup in the microwave.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an appliance for washing clothes
example: La ropa está en la lavadora. (The clothes are in the washing machine.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a clothes dryer
example: La ropa está en la secadora. (The clothes are in the dryer.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an institution for learning
example: Voy a la escuela todos los días. (I go to school every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an institution for higher education
example: Estudia en la universidad. (She studies at the university.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a printed or written work
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (I am reading an interesting book.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a small book for writing
example: Escribe en tu cuaderno. (Write in your notebook.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a writing instrument
example: Necesito un lápiz para escribir. (I need a pencil to write.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a writing instrument with ink
example: Tengo un bolígrafo rojo. (I have a red pen.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a measuring instrument for straight lines
example: Mide con la regla. (Measure with the ruler.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a tool for erasing pencil marks
example: Usa el borrador para corregir. (Use the eraser to correct.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a thin sheet of material for writing or printing
example: Necesito más papel. (I need more paper.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a lesson or course
example: Mi clase empieza a las ocho. (My class starts at eight.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a person who teaches
example: El profesor está explicando la lección. (The teacher is explaining the lesson.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a person who is learning
example: El estudiante está tomando apuntes. (The student is taking notes.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a test or evaluation
example: Tengo un examen mañana. (I have an exam tomorrow.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a score or mark
example: Obtuve una buena nota en el examen. (I got a good grade on the exam.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to assignments given outside of class
example: Tengo mucha tarea esta noche. (I have a lot of homework tonight.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a book used for studying
example: Abre tu libro de texto en la página veinte. (Open your textbook to page twenty.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an electronic device for processing data
example: La computadora está encendida. (The computer is on.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the global network of computers
example: Estoy navegando por Internet. (I am browsing the Internet.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to an electronic message
example: Recibí un correo electrónico ayer. (I received an email yesterday.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to a mobile or landline phone
example: Mi teléfono está apagado. (My phone is off.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to calling someone on the phone
example: Voy a llamar a mi madre. (I’m going to call my mother.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to sending something (e.g., a message)
example: Voy a mandar un correo electrónico. (I’m going to send an email.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to receiving something
example: Recibí un paquete hoy. (I received a package today.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to speaking or talking
example: Ella habla muy rápido. (She speaks very fast.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to listening to sounds or someone
example: Escucho música todos los días. (I listen to music every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of seeing with your eyes
example: Veo la televisión. (I watch TV.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to reading books, articles, etc.
example: Estoy leyendo un artículo. (I am reading an article.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to writing
example: Voy a escribir una carta. (I’m going to write a letter.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to studying or learning
example: Estudio matemáticas todos los días. (I study mathematics every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to taking a break or resting
example: Necesito descansar un poco. (I need to rest a little.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to working or doing a job
example: Trabajo en una oficina. (I work in an office.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to eating food
example: Vamos a comer pizza. (Let’s eat pizza.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to drinking liquids
example: Voy a beber agua. (I’m going to drink water.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to running or jogging
example: Ella corre todos los días. (She runs every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to jumping or leaping
example: El niño salta la cuerda. (The child jumps rope.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to dancing
example: Me gusta bailar salsa. (I like to dance salsa.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to swimming
example: Nosotros nadamos en el océano. (We swim in the ocean.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to walking
example: Caminamos al parque. (We walk to the park.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to going to different places
example: Voy a viajar a España. (I’m going to travel to Spain.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to living in a place or in general
example: Vivo en Madrid. (I live in Madrid.)

when_to_say: Use when agreeing to something or accepting an offer
example: Acepté la invitación para la fiesta. (I accepted the invitation to the party.)

when_to_say: Use when refusing or declining something
example: Rechacé la propuesta de trabajo. (I rejected the job offer.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to waiting for something or someone
example: Estoy esperando el autobús. (I’m waiting for the bus.)

when_to_say: Use when helping someone with something
example: Voy a ayudar a mi hermano. (I’m going to help my brother.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to taking care of someone or something
example: Tengo que cuidar mi mascota. (I have to take care of my pet.)

when_to_say: Use when protecting something or someone
example: Los padres protegen a sus hijos. (Parents protect their children.)

when_to_say: Use when making a request or asking for something
example: Pido ayuda con mi tarea. (I ask for help with my homework.)

when_to_say: Use when giving something to someone
example: Le di un regalo a mi amigo. (I gave a gift to my friend.)

when_to_say: Use when collecting or picking up something
example: Voy a recoger las llaves. (I’m going to pick up the keys.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to carrying something
example: Llevo una mochila al colegio. (I carry a backpack to school.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to possession or existence
example: Tengo dos hermanos. (I have two brothers.)

when_to_say: Use when describing a characteristic or identity
example: Él es médico. (He is a doctor.)

when_to_say: Use when describing a temporary state or location
example: Estoy cansado. (I am tired.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to doing or making something
example: Voy a hacer mi tarea. (I’m going to do my homework.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to seeing or observing
example: Veo el mar desde mi ventana. (I see the sea from my window.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to hearing sounds
example: Oigo música de fondo. (I hear music in the background.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to feeling emotions or physical sensations
example: Siento mucho frío. (I feel very cold.)

when_to_say: Use when expressing desire or want
example: Quiero comer pizza. (I want to eat pizza.)

when_to_say: Use when expressing preference
example: Prefiero el té al café. (I prefer tea over coffee.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to something you require or need
example: Necesito más tiempo. (I need more time.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of living or residing
example: Vivo en Madrid. (I live in Madrid.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of traveling
example: Me gusta viajar a la playa. (I like to travel to the beach.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to learning or studying something
example: Estudio matemáticas todos los días. (I study math every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of working
example: Trabajo en una oficina. (I work in an office.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of buying something
example: Voy a comprar una camisa nueva. (I’m going to buy a new shirt.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to selling something
example: Ella vende frutas en el mercado. (She sells fruits at the market.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of reading
example: Me gusta leer libros. (I like to read books.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to the act of writing
example: Escribo cartas a mis amigos. (I write letters to my friends.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to eating food
example: Me gusta comer pizza. (I like to eat pizza.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to drinking
example: Bebo agua todos los días. (I drink water every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to dancing
example: Me encanta bailar salsa. (I love to dance salsa.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to singing
example: Canto en un coro. (I sing in a choir.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to playing a game or sport
example: Juego al fútbol con mis amigos. (I play soccer with my friends.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to doing work
example: Trabajo en una oficina de lunes a viernes. (I work in an office from Monday to Friday.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to studying or learning
example: Estudio para mis exámenes. (I study for my exams.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to listening to something
example: Escucho música mientras trabajo. (I listen to music while I work.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to looking at something
example: Miro el atardecer cada tarde. (I look at the sunset every evening.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to walking somewhere
example: Camino al trabajo todos los días. (I walk to work every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to swimming
example: Nado en la piscina cada mañana. (I swim in the pool every morning.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to jumping
example: Me gusta saltar en el parque. (I like to jump in the park.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to running
example: Corro todos los días para mantenerme en forma. (I run every day to stay in shape.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to swimming
example: Me gusta nadar en la piscina. (I like to swim in the pool.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to sleeping
example: Yo duermo ocho horas cada noche. (I sleep eight hours every night.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to playing a game or sport
example: Jugamos al fútbol los fines de semana. (We play soccer on weekends.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to studying or learning
example: Estudio historia en la universidad. (I study history at the university.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to drinking something
example: Bebo agua todos los días. (I drink water every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to cooking food
example: Cocino para mi familia todos los días. (I cook for my family every day.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to reading
example: Leo libros todas las noches. (I read books every night.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to writing
example: Escribo cartas a mis amigos. (I write letters to my friends.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to calling someone on the phone
example: Llamo a mis padres cada semana. (I call my parents every week.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to seeing something
example: Veo una película en el cine. (I watch a movie at the cinema.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to going out
example: Salgo con mis amigos los viernes. (I go out with my friends on Fridays.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to entering a place
example: Entro en la tienda para comprar pan. (I enter the store to buy bread.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to temporary conditions or locations
example: Estoy cansado hoy. (I am tired today.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to permanent qualities or identities
example: Soy profesor de español. (I am a Spanish teacher.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to doing or making something
example: Hago mi tarea todas las noches. (I do my homework every night.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to eating
example: Comemos juntos cada noche. (We eat together every night.)

when_to_say: Use when referring to learning something new
example: Estoy aprendiendo español. (I am learning Spanish.)
